article.description: Evan Bradds finished with 27 points, eight rebounds and five assists while Craig Bradshaw scored 19 to lead Belmont past Lipscomb 93-84 Monday night.
article.headline: Bradds, Bradshaw lead Belmont to 93-84 win over Lipscomb
article.linkText: Bradds, Bradshaw lead Belmont to 93-84 win over Lipscomb
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. -- Evan Bradds finished with 27 points, eight rebounds and five assists while Craig Bradshaw scored 19 to lead Belmont past Lipscomb 93-84 Monday night. Bradds made 9 of 10 field goals and all nine of his free throw attempts. Austin Luke had 12 points, seven rebounds and eight assists for Belmont (6-4) and Taylor Barnette scored 11. Josh Williams made a jumper to cut Lipscomb's deficit to five with 4:25 remaining but Bradds made two free throws and then converted a 3-point play before Luke made a layup to put the Bruins up 82-70 less than a minute later. Lipscomb (3-8) pulled within seven on a layup by J.C. Hampton with 2:31 to play, but would get no closer. Belmont made 32 of 56 field goals (57 percent) and hit 21 of 24 free throws (88 percent). Williams led the Bisons with 21 points. The Bruins beat Lipscomb 105-89 on Dec. 1.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
